column1: Bavette's Bar & Boeuf////The first table at which we were seated was a bit small and in an area with heavy foot traffic
column2: so we requested to move.  They were very accommodating and moved us to a booth which was great.  We started with the thick cut bacon
column3: which in my opinion was an improvement over the bacons at other steakhouses due to the peppercorn enhanced flavor.  For an entree
column4: the 10 oz filet with bearnaise was prepared perfectly; you could cut it with a butter knife.  Our sides were the truffle mac n cheese and the pommes frites
column5: both of which were delicious.  We finished with the famous chocolate cream pie which definitely lived up to its reputation.
